metadata.label: Clinical Intervention - Ipratropium Inhaler
metadata.description:
Long-term management of COPD with inhaled bronchodilator maintenance therapy.
Ipratropium Inhaler reduces the disability weight of persons living with COPD by 16.9%, providing long-acting bronchodilation for maintenance therapy.
This intervention targets 21% of the COPD population who require ongoing bronchodilator therapy for symptom management and prevention of exacerbations.
This intervention increases target coverage from the baseline of five percent to ninety-five percent.

Ipratropium Inhaler Baseline Coverage.description: The baseline coverage for the intervention

Ipratropium Inhaler Target Coverage.description: The target coverage for the intervention

Ipratropium Inhaler Scale-Up Start Year.description: The index when scale-up starts for this intervention, where 0 == the first year of the time horizon

Ipratropium Inhaler Scale-Up Final Year.description: The index when scale-up ends for this intervention, where 0 == the first year of the time horizon

Ipratropium Inhaler Population In Need.description: The proportion of persons who require the intervention

Ipratropium Inhaler Disability Impact.description: The proportion by which the disability weight is reduced due to the intervention
